SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.photos.controllers

Class AdminPageController

java.lang.Object
com.photos.controllers.AdminPageController
public class AdminPageController extends Object
The AdminPageController class manages the user interface and actions on the administrator page. provides functionality to initialize the controller, handle the admin log-out, create user, and delete user actions.

    • AdminPageController

      public AdminPageController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the AdminPageController. Sets up the user list table with a username column, populates the list with existing users, and displays it in the user interface.

    • handleAdminLogOutButton

      public void handleAdminLogOutButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event for logging out the administrator. Loads the login page and displays it in a new window, then saves the user list.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent associated with the admin log-out action.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue handling the admin log-out.

    • handleCreateUserButton

      public void handleCreateUserButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event for creating a new user. Loads the user creation page and displays it in a new window.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent associated with the create user action.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue handling the user creation.

    • handleDeleteUserButton

      public void handleDeleteUserButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action event for deleting a selected user. Checks if a user is selected and removes the user from both the displayed list and the underlying user list. Displays an information alert if no user is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent associated with the delete user action.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an issue handling the user deletion.
